content.text: Assemble the circuit as shown in Fig. 1.1
• A and B are crocodile clips. PQ and RS are wires
Connect A near the midpoint of PQ
• Measure and record the length \(x\) of wire between P and A
Connect B to RS
• Close the switch
• Adjust the position of B until the voltmeter reading is as close as possible to zero
• Measure and record the length \(y\) of wire between R and B
• Open the switch
Change \(x\) and repeat **(b)** until you have six sets of values of \(x\) and \(y\)
Record your results in a table
Include values of \(\frac{1}{x}\) and \(\frac{1}{y}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{y}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{x}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
It is suggested that the quantities \(y\) and \(x\) are related by the equation
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
Use your answers in **(d)(iii)** to determine the values of \(a\) and \(b\)
Give appropriate units
a =
b =
In this experiment, you will investigate an electrical circuit
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.1
• Adjust the apparatus until the angle \(\theta\) between the board and the bench has a value between \(32^{\circ}\) and \(38^{\circ}\)
• Measure and record \(\theta\)
Attach the newton meter to the wooden block using the string loop
• Place the block on the board, with the label of the block at the top
• Pull the newton meter and block up the board at a constant speed. Keep the string loop parallel to the board, as shown in Fig. 2.2
• Record the force \(F\) when the block is travelling at a constant speed
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(F\)
percentage uncertainty =   .........
• Adjust the board so that \(\theta\) is between \(12^{\circ}\) and \(18^{\circ}\)
• Measure and record \(\theta\)
Repeat (b)
Using the newton meter, measure and record the weight \(W\) of the block and hook
Using your data, calculate two values of \(\mu\)
first value of \(\mu =\)
second value of \(\mu =\)
Explain whether your results support the suggested relationship
It is suggested that the relationship between \(F, W\) and \(\theta\) is
where \(\mu\) is a constant
Using your second value of \(\mu\), calculate the value of \(F\) when \(\theta = 65^{\circ}\)
Give your answer to an appropriate number of significant figures
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
Describe four improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate the friction between an inclined board and a wooden block
